name: Aisha Ali
clarity_response: An app that builds a living taste profile from your experience ratings and uses friends' ratings for discovery. One-tap, no reviews. Like Beli for everything.
strongest_line: You've been to hundreds of places. You remember maybe twenty.
what_feels_off: Almost nothing. Minor: 'priority in local discovery' for Pro still undefined — what does that mean exactly?
objections: Still need to see the interface before paying. But I'd download free immediately.
gut_reaction: Tighter and sharper than before. The taste analytics detail — neighborhoods, categories, friend comparisons — is exactly the specificity I needed to consider Pro.
unanswered_questions: Still need to see the interface before paying. But I'd download free immediately.
price_reaction: $99/year is the right anchor. That's $8.25/month — easily justifiable for a tool I'd use daily.

name: Ezra Chen
clarity_response: A taste profile system — rate experiences, it ranks them, friends' network powers discovery. Searchable personal record plus social recommendations.
strongest_line: Searchable. Sortable. Yours.
what_feels_off: Nitpicking: the testimonials are good but adding one from someone who upgraded from free to Pro would strengthen the conversion path.
objections: What does 'priority in local discovery' mean specifically?
gut_reaction: This reads faster and hits harder. Everything that matters is still here but I'm not skimming anymore.
unanswered_questions: What does 'priority in local discovery' mean specifically?
price_reaction: The annual option makes this feel like a serious product. I'd go $99/year after a month on free.

name: Daniela O'Brien
clarity_response: It turns one-tap experience ratings into a personal taste profile and uses friend networks for discovery. Covers restaurants, bars, hikes, everything.
strongest_line: See which neighborhoods you rate highest, how your taste compares to friends, and which categories you're pickiest about.
what_feels_off: Very minor: I miss the specific examples (8/10 Thai place). They were grounding. The page trades specificity for speed.
objections: Data export — can I take my taste profile with me if I leave?
gut_reaction: The annual pricing makes me take this more seriously. $99/year feels like commitment to a real tool, not another monthly subscription I'll forget about.
unanswered_questions: Data export — can I take my taste profile with me if I leave?
price_reaction: Fair pricing. Free is generous, Pro at $99/year is competitive with other premium apps I use.

name: Kai Franklin
clarity_response: A living taste profile app — rate experiences, build a ranked record, discover better plans through friends' trusted ratings instead of algorithms.
strongest_line: One tap. That's it.
what_feels_off: Nothing significant. The page is tight and confident. My remaining objection is about the product, not the pitch.
objections: The rating system — is it 1-10? Contextual? Matters for someone who rates seriously.
gut_reaction: Strong page. Every section earns its space. The retroactive rating being right next to 'one tap' is a better flow.
unanswered_questions: The rating system — is it 1-10? Contextual? Matters for someone who rates seriously.
price_reaction: The referral → $99/year path makes sense. Try free, earn Pro month, go annual. Clean funnel.

name: Diego Larsson
clarity_response: An experience ranking app that creates a personal taste profile. Friends' ratings power discovery. Works solo, gets better with friends.
strongest_line: Your taste deserves better than this.
what_feels_off: The retention section could have one proof point — like '87% of users who rate 10+ times in week one are still active at 90 days.' Data > claims.
objections: Platform availability? iOS/Android/web?
gut_reaction: I appreciate that they tightened this without losing the personality. It's still specific and confident, just faster.
unanswered_questions: Platform availability? iOS/Android/web?
price_reaction: Annual pricing signals confidence. They expect me to stay. I like that.

name: Isaiah Singh
clarity_response: You rate experiences one tap, it builds a taste profile, friends' activity surfaces recommendations. Beli for all experiences, not just food.
strongest_line: Not a list. Not a journal. A living, ranked record.
what_feels_off: Tiny: 'random Tuesday night plans' in the hero — feels slightly forced. Everything else is natural.
objections: How many active users? The network promise requires a network.
gut_reaction: The taste analytics description sold me on Pro. 'Which neighborhoods you rate highest' — that's the kind of data I want about myself.
unanswered_questions: How many active users? The network promise requires a network.
price_reaction: $99/year is my sweet spot for a lifestyle app. Monthly felt tentative. Annual feels like commitment.

name: Malachi Kim
clarity_response: A taste-based ranking system for real-world experiences with friend-powered discovery. One tap to rate, personal profile builds over time.
strongest_line: Less mediocre. More you.
what_feels_off: Nothing. This is the cleanest version. Ready to try the product.
objections: I'd want the taste analytics data in more detail. The description is better but I want to see a demo.
gut_reaction: Clean, punchy, confident. No section feels like filler. This is the version I'd send to a friend.
unanswered_questions: I'd want the taste analytics data in more detail. The description is better but I want to see a demo.
price_reaction: Good value. Taste analytics alone might be worth $99/year if they're as good as described.

name: Nia Adeyemi
clarity_response: An app that builds your taste profile from quick ratings and uses your friend network for personalized discovery. No reviews required.
strongest_line: Rate it now, or add it later — your profile doesn't care about timestamps.
what_feels_off: The page still doesn't show the interface. A single screenshot in the 'How It Works' section would be powerful.
objections: Will the app nag about upgrading? I hate aggressive upsells.
gut_reaction: The problem section flows better — forgetting AND not discovering are in the same breath now. That's how the problem actually feels.
unanswered_questions: Will the app nag about upgrading? I hate aggressive upsells.
price_reaction: I'd start free, convert to annual within 2 months. The pricing is right.

name: Leila Williams
clarity_response: It ranks your experiences into a living taste profile and uses friends' ratings to help you discover better things. Network-powered, not algorithm-powered.
strongest_line: Three months in and I still rate everything. It takes literally two seconds.
what_feels_off: Nothing feels off. The only gap is visual — I want to see the app, not just read about it.
objections: How does it handle travel vs. home city experiences?
gut_reaction: Ready to download. The copy has done its job. Now I need to touch the product.
unanswered_questions: How does it handle travel vs. home city experiences?
price_reaction: The pricing section is the most improved part. Clear tiers, annual option, referral incentive. Professional.

name: Deja Kowalski
clarity_response: A personal taste profile that grows from your ratings plus friend-network discovery. Rate anything in one tap, find better stuff through people you trust.
strongest_line: $99/year
what_feels_off: Minor: 'ranked experiences across every category' in free tier — still wondering what categories specifically.
objections: What about categories like concerts or art shows? How granular?
gut_reaction: The $99/year option is smart. I was on the fence at $12/month. Annual with a discount tips me over.
unanswered_questions: What about categories like concerts or art shows? How granular?
price_reaction: $99/year. Done. The free tier proved it's real, the Pro features are worth it.

name: Carmen Russo
clarity_response: An experience ranking app — personal taste profile plus friend-based discovery. One tap, no reviews, covers all experience types.
strongest_line: Your taste already exists — scattered across apps, memory, and half-remembered conversations.
what_feels_off: Nothing. Copy is dialed. Product needs to deliver now.
objections: I'm convinced enough to try free. Pro depends on the network quality in my city.
gut_reaction: Strongest version yet. Specific where it matters, concise where it doesn't. The testimonials are earning their space.
unanswered_questions: I'm convinced enough to try free. Pro depends on the network quality in my city.
price_reaction: Annual pricing removed my 'subscription fatigue' objection. $99 once feels different than $12 twelve times.

name: Marcus Rivera
clarity_response: It creates a living, ranked record of your experiences and uses friends' activity for discovery. Works solo from day one, network enhances over time.
strongest_line: This isn't a trial. It's the real product.
what_feels_off: Extremely minor: the social proof section could benefit from a sixth testimonial from a skeptic who was converted.
objections: No major objections remaining. Ready to evaluate the product itself.
gut_reaction: I'd sign up for free today and likely convert to annual Pro within a month. The page earns that confidence.
unanswered_questions: No major objections remaining. Ready to evaluate the product itself.
price_reaction: Fair price for a premium product. The free tier builds trust, annual Pro rewards commitment.

name: Ananya Chowdhury
clarity_response: A social taste profile app — rate experiences, friends' ratings power collective discovery. Like sharing your whole group's taste in one place.
strongest_line: Your friend who always finds the best dive bars? You'll see their top-rated spots in your neighborhood.
what_feels_off: The page is tight but I'd still want to see the actual social interface. A screenshot of friend discovery would help.
objections: The invite flow is everything. If it's friction-heavy, the referral incentive won't matter.
gut_reaction: Punchy. I didn't lose interest once. The friend network section is still the strongest part and it's even tighter now.
unanswered_questions: The invite flow is everything. If it's friction-heavy, the referral incentive won't matter.
price_reaction: The referral incentive is my entry point. Then $99/year. Smart pricing.

name: Amir Tanaka
clarity_response: Friend-powered experience discovery. Everyone rates things, builds taste profiles, and the network surfaces the best stuff. One tap, no reviews.
strongest_line: Network-powered discovery that actually feels like getting a rec from a friend. Because it is one.
what_feels_off: Nothing feels off in the copy. My remaining questions are all about the product experience.
objections: What does 'basic friend activity' actually include in the free tier?
gut_reaction: The referral incentive plus annual pricing gives me two paths to Pro. Smart. I'd earn the free month first, then go annual.
unanswered_questions: What does 'basic friend activity' actually include in the free tier?
price_reaction: $99/year is fair. I'd earn the free month through referrals, then go annual.

name: Keiko Yamamoto
clarity_response: An experience ranking app where friend networks drive discovery. Personal taste profiles plus social recommendations. Beli for everything.
strongest_line: Now I just send them my profile.
what_feels_off: Very minor: 'basic friend activity' in free — still not entirely clear what that includes vs. Pro.
objections: Can I share my profile or individual recs outside the app?
gut_reaction: Every line feels intentional. Nothing wasted. The kind of page I'd screenshot and send to my group chat.
unanswered_questions: Can I share my profile or individual recs outside the app?
price_reaction: Free basic friend activity is the critical piece. $99/year for full network discovery is worth it if friends are on it.

name: Rohan Shah
clarity_response: You and friends rate experiences, build taste profiles, and discover better plans through each other's trusted ratings. Network-powered.
strongest_line: Invite 3 friends → get your first month of Pro free.
what_feels_off: Nothing. The referral incentive, the social framing, the testimonials — all working. Just need to try it.
objections: How many friends for the network to feel useful?
gut_reaction: The tighter version works better for sharing. When I text this link to friends, they'll actually read it on their phone.
unanswered_questions: How many friends for the network to feel useful?
price_reaction: The pricing model finally aligns with the product. Social grows free, power users pay annually. Correct.

name: Omar Hayes
clarity_response: A taste profile platform with friend-based discovery. Rate experiences one tap, see friends' top picks, find better things through real trust.
strongest_line: First it's your map. Then it's your map plus everyone you trust.
what_feels_off: The page doesn't mention group features. Can friends collaborate on plans? That's my actual workflow.
objections: Privacy controls — can I customize what different friends see?
gut_reaction: Good energy. The social proof section is pulling serious weight — Jordan's testimonial is still the one I relate to most.
unanswered_questions: Privacy controls — can I customize what different friends see?
price_reaction: I'd go annual immediately after the referral month. $99 is a good deal for what's described.

name: Aaliyah Martinez
clarity_response: An app that builds taste profiles from ratings and connects friend networks for discovery. Social recommendations from people you trust.
strongest_line: Not through some algorithm guessing... but through the actual people you trust.
what_feels_off: Nothing off. Slight wish: a mention of how the invite experience works. But that's product, not copy.
objections: Group planning features — can friends coordinate through the app?
gut_reaction: The 'first it's your map, then it's your map plus everyone you trust' line hits different now that it's not buried in explanation.
unanswered_questions: Group planning features — can friends coordinate through the app?
price_reaction: $99/year makes more sense than $12/month for a social app. I'm committing to the network.

name: Nadia Hoffman
clarity_response: Friend-powered experience discovery — personal taste profiles from ratings, network surfaces the best stuff. Works solo, better with friends.
strongest_line: Their discoveries become yours.
what_feels_off: The Beli comparison is still slightly limiting — some people don't know Beli. But the clarification helps.
objections: Can I see friends-of-friends recommendations?
gut_reaction: I'd download this from an Instagram ad without hesitation. The page is exactly the right length for a social scroll.
unanswered_questions: Can I see friends-of-friends recommendations?
price_reaction: Great pricing structure. Free to spread, annual to commit. The referral bridges them.

name: Cedric Cruz
clarity_response: A social experience app — taste profiles from quick ratings, friend network discovery. Share your taste, see friends' picks.
strongest_line: See what's highly rated by the people you actually trust. No strangers. No sponsored posts.
what_feels_off: Nothing. This page would convert me. The remaining gap is between 'convinced' and 'downloaded.'
objections: What's the invite experience for someone receiving my link?
gut_reaction: Stronger flow. Problem → solution → network → retention → proof → pricing. Nothing interrupts the momentum.
unanswered_questions: What's the invite experience for someone receiving my link?
price_reaction: $99/year is an easy sell to myself. Harder to sell friends on it, but their free tier is enough.

name: Dante Cooper
clarity_response: Rate experiences, build taste profiles, discover through friends. Network-powered recommendations instead of algorithmic guesses.
strongest_line: Network-powered discovery... Because it is one.
what_feels_off: Minor: no mention of privacy controls for what friends can see. Important for a social app.
objections: How does the app handle different friend groups with different tastes?
gut_reaction: The annual option makes the pricing section feel more legitimate. $99/year signals 'real product' more than $12/month alone.
unanswered_questions: How does the app handle different friend groups with different tastes?
price_reaction: The annual option makes me more likely to convert. Monthly feels like I'm hedging. Annual feels like I'm in.

name: Rachel Patel
clarity_response: An experience ranking platform with social discovery. Your ratings and friends' ratings create personalized, trusted recommendations.
strongest_line: Less mediocre. More you.
what_feels_off: Nothing major. The copy is the right length, the right tone, the right specificity.
objections: I'm downloading this week. My only real objection is product-level.
gut_reaction: Clean and confident. The only thing I'd still want is a video showing the social features. But the copy alone might be enough.
unanswered_questions: I'm downloading this week. My only real objection is product-level.
price_reaction: Best pricing version. Clear, fair, multiple paths to Pro. I'd convert.

name: Megan Nakamura
clarity_response: A taste-based social app — everyone's ratings build profiles, friend networks power discovery. One tap, real signal from real people.
strongest_line: This isn't a trial. It's the real product.
what_feels_off: Would love to see user numbers. 'Join X thousand users' would add social proof momentum.
objections: User numbers would help me decide. Is the network big enough?
gut_reaction: This is the version that would convert my friend group. Short enough to read on a phone, specific enough to be convincing.
unanswered_questions: User numbers would help me decide. Is the network big enough?
price_reaction: I'd pay $99/year happily if 5+ friends are active. The referral gets me there.

name: Tariq Oduya
clarity_response: An app where experience ratings build taste profiles and friend networks create trusted discovery. Beli expanded to all experiences.
strongest_line: The app gets better with every friend who joins.
what_feels_off: Nothing. Best version of this page.
objections: No copy-level objections. Ready to try.
gut_reaction: I'm in. The referral path is my entry point. I'll have 3 friends on this within a week.
unanswered_questions: No copy-level objections. Ready to try.
price_reaction: $99/year. No hesitation. The product concept is worth it if the network delivers.

name: Tobias Kapoor
clarity_response: A one-tap experience rating app that builds a taste profile. Friends' ratings power discovery. Designed for momentum — weekly recaps, compounding value.
strongest_line: One tap. That's it.
what_feels_off: I miss the 'most apps die after a week' honesty. It was brave and it earned my trust. The retention section is still good but less personal.
objections: Still no passive tracking. Location detection would make this truly effortless.
gut_reaction: Still skeptical, but less than before. The retention section is shorter and punchier — 'momentum, not effort' is the right idea.
unanswered_questions: Still no passive tracking. Location detection would make this truly effortless.
price_reaction: Annual is irrelevant to me. I need to survive 90 days on free before thinking about money.

name: Yuki Lee
clarity_response: An experience ranking app — rate in two seconds, builds taste profile, friends help with discovery. Has retention features to keep you engaged.
strongest_line: Rate it now, or add it later — your profile doesn't care about timestamps.
what_feels_off: The page is better for my attention span but worse for my trust. The honesty was the thing that made me think these people understand me.
objections: What's the actual 30-day retention rate? Numbers > testimonials for me.
gut_reaction: Missing the 'most apps die after a week' line. That was the most honest thing I've read on a landing page. But the three-month testimonial carries similar weight.
unanswered_questions: What's the actual 30-day retention rate? Numbers > testimonials for me.
price_reaction: The free tier is all I'll use for months. Maybe forever. And the page says that's okay.

name: Kenji Johansson
clarity_response: A taste profile app with one-tap ratings and friend-powered discovery. Built around momentum, not effort. Profile compounds over time.
strongest_line: One tap, one number. No review. No paragraph. No photo required.
what_feels_off: The retention section works but it's promises. The testimonial about three months is the actual proof. Maybe lean on that harder.
objections: The weekly recap — is that a push notification, email, or in-app? Matters for engagement.
gut_reaction: The tighter page actually helps me. I lose interest on long pages. By the time I hit pricing I'm still engaged.
unanswered_questions: The weekly recap — is that a push notification, email, or in-app? Matters for engagement.
price_reaction: I appreciate not being pressured. The pricing respects that some users need time to build the habit.

name: Jenna Okafor
clarity_response: Rate experiences fast, build a taste profile, discover through friends. Retroactive entries allowed. Designed to keep you coming back.
strongest_line: Three months in and I still rate everything. It takes literally two seconds.
what_feels_off: Nothing new feels off. Everything that felt off before is about the product, not the copy.
objections: Can I batch-rate experiences from a whole week at once?
dealbreaker_reason: Retention promises without data. Need to see real retention metrics.
gut_reaction: The retroactive rating being front and center matters. 'Your profile doesn't care about timestamps' removes my biggest pressure point.
unanswered_questions: Can I batch-rate experiences from a whole week at once?
price_reaction: $99/year IF I prove I'll use it. Big if. The free tier is the right starting point.

name: Theo Diaz
clarity_response: A quick-rating experience app — taste profile plus friend discovery. Weekly recaps and friend nudges for retention. Compounds over time.
strongest_line: Your profile compounds, so month three is dramatically more useful than day one.
what_feels_off: The compound effect argument is logical but my abandonment isn't logical. Need emotional hooks, not just rational ones.
objections: Is there gamification? Streaks can be motivating but also guilt-inducing.
gut_reaction: Shorter is better for someone like me. If the page feels like effort to read, the app will feel like effort to use.
unanswered_questions: Is there gamification? Streaks can be motivating but also guilt-inducing.
price_reaction: Price isn't my barrier. Behavior is. Free removes the financial excuse, which is progress.

name: Finn Delgado
clarity_response: An experience ranking system built for effortless use. One-tap ratings, taste profile, friend discovery. Momentum-based retention.
strongest_line: Built around momentum, not effort.
what_feels_off: The shorter page IS better for someone like me. Less to read, less to feel overwhelmed by. Good instinct.
objections: How does re-engagement work after a 2-week gap? That's my make-or-break.
gut_reaction: I notice the honesty line is gone. I respected that. But the retention section still makes the right promises. And the Reese testimonial is proof.
unanswered_questions: How does re-engagement work after a 2-week gap? That's my make-or-break.
price_reaction: I'd use free for 3-6 months before considering Pro. $99/year is fair if I get there.

name: Chloe Vasquez
clarity_response: You rate experiences in seconds, it builds your taste profile, friends power discovery. Retroactive entries, weekly recaps, compounding value.
strongest_line: One tap. That's it.
what_feels_off: Still no mention of passive tracking or automation. That's a product gap but it matters to me.
objections: I'd try free for 3 months minimum before considering Pro. That's my honest timeline.
gut_reaction: The compound effect argument lands better in a shorter section. Less preamble, more substance.
unanswered_questions: I'd try free for 3 months minimum before considering Pro. That's my honest timeline.
price_reaction: The annual option is for future-me. Present-me needs to prove something first.

name: Tara Ibrahim
clarity_response: A taste profile app — one-tap rating, friend-network discovery. Designed for people who abandon apps — momentum over effort.
strongest_line: Rate it now, or add it later.
what_feels_off: The page can't prove retention. Only the app can. I understand this. I'll try it.
objections: Is there an Apple Watch or widget for truly one-tap rating?
gut_reaction: I'm at the point where my objection is about me, not the product or the page. That means the copy is doing everything it can.
unanswered_questions: Is there an Apple Watch or widget for truly one-tap rating?
price_reaction: Good pricing for people who know they'll use it. For people like me, the generous free tier is the price point.

name: Camille Bautista
clarity_response: Rate experiences quickly, build a living taste profile, discover through friends. Compounds so month three is better than day one.
strongest_line: Not a list. Not a journal.
what_feels_off: Nothing new. The page has addressed everything it can. The rest is on the product.
objections: How does it handle the guilt of not rating? Does it shame me or welcome me back?
dealbreaker_reason: No passive tracking. Manual entry = guaranteed eventual abandonment for me.
gut_reaction: The annual pricing is irrelevant to me — I'm not committing to a year of anything. But the free tier is still generous enough.
unanswered_questions: How does it handle the guilt of not rating? Does it shame me or welcome me back?
price_reaction: Fair. Not my concern. My concern is whether I'll open the app in March.

name: Ethan Bennett
clarity_response: An experience rating app that builds taste profiles and uses friend networks for discovery. One-tap, retroactive, designed for retention.
strongest_line: Two seconds. Done.
what_feels_off: Minor: annual pricing is irrelevant to my segment. We need to survive 30 days before thinking about a year.
objections: The compound value argument makes sense but I need to experience it.
gut_reaction: Better than V2 for my attention span. I read the whole thing without skimming. That's rare for me.
unanswered_questions: The compound value argument makes sense but I need to experience it.
price_reaction: $99/year is fine in a world where I use this regularly. The probability of that world is my issue.

name: Elena Stein
clarity_response: A taste-based experience tracker with friend discovery. One tap, no writing, retroactive entries. Built around momentum, not effort.
strongest_line: This isn't a trial. It's the real product.
what_feels_off: The three-month testimonial is carrying heavy weight for my segment. Consider adding another retention-focused quote.
objections: My objection is my own behavior pattern, not the product or the copy.
gut_reaction: Still not sure I'll stick with it. But I'm sure enough to try. The page earned that.
unanswered_questions: My objection is my own behavior pattern, not the product or the copy.
price_reaction: The free tier removes risk. That's the most important pricing decision on this page.

name: Miles Owens
clarity_response: Rate experiences in two seconds, build taste profile, friend-powered discovery. Weekly recaps and compounding profile keep you engaged.
strongest_line: Three months in and I still rate everything.
what_feels_off: Nothing off. My skepticism is about myself, which is the healthiest place for the copy to leave me.
objections: I'll download it. Whether I'm still using it in April is the real question.
gut_reaction: The three-month testimonial is doing the work the honesty line used to do. Someone like me lasted three months. That's the proof I need.
unanswered_questions: I'll download it. Whether I'm still using it in April is the real question.
price_reaction: I appreciate the pricing flexibility. Free → referral → monthly → annual is the right ladder for skeptics.

name: Kira Petrov
clarity_response: An app that builds your taste profile AND helps you discover what to do next through friends' ratings. Both backward-looking and forward-looking.
strongest_line: Choosing feels like work when you don't have a system.
what_feels_off: The shorter page is significantly better. I read every word. On V2 I started skimming. That's a real difference.
objections: How does discovery work when I don't have many friends on the app? What's the bootstrapping experience?
gut_reaction: This version MOVES. I read the whole thing on my phone without losing interest. And 'choosing feels like work when you don't have a system' is still the line that got me.
unanswered_questions: How does discovery work when I don't have many friends on the app? What's the bootstrapping experience?
price_reaction: $99/year is interesting. Cheaper per month and it forces me to commit. That might actually help with follow-through.

name: Maya Park
clarity_response: A taste profile plus discovery app — rate experiences, build your record, find better plans through friends' trusted recommendations.
strongest_line: Discover what's next through the people you trust.
what_feels_off: Nothing feels off. The pacing is right, the discovery angle is clear, the pricing is reasonable.
objections: Is there a 'do something now' feature or is it purely rating-based discovery?
gut_reaction: Way better pacing. The discovery angle is clear from the hero and I never lose the thread. This is the version that would make me tap 'download.'
unanswered_questions: Is there a 'do something now' feature or is it purely rating-based discovery?
price_reaction: I'd try free, earn the referral month, then decide between monthly and annual. $99/year is fair if discovery works.

name: Mila Bergström
clarity_response: Experience discovery powered by friend networks. Rate things one tap, build a taste profile, discover what's next through people you trust.
strongest_line: Scrolling 'best of' lists for twenty minutes and ending up on the couch.
what_feels_off: Minor: still wish there was a 'what to do right now' feature described. The app is discovery-adjacent but not quite 'here's your Saturday plan.'
objections: What does the free discovery experience look like vs. Pro?
gut_reaction: The shorter problem section is stronger. Both pains — forgetting good places AND not knowing what to do — hit in one breath.
unanswered_questions: What does the free discovery experience look like vs. Pro?
price_reaction: The annual option makes Pro feel more accessible. $8.25/month is easier to justify than $12/month.

name: Nico Brooks
clarity_response: An app that tracks experiences AND surfaces what to do next. Taste profile from ratings, friend-powered discovery. Not just logging.
strongest_line: Less mediocre. More you.
what_feels_off: Nothing. This is the version that converts me. Tighter, faster, same punch.
objections: $99/year is tempting but I'd want free → monthly → annual as my path. Not jumping straight to annual.
gut_reaction: I feel like this was designed for someone scrolling Instagram. Quick, punchy, specific. The right length for a mobile read.
unanswered_questions: $99/year is tempting but I'd want free → monthly → annual as my path. Not jumping straight to annual.
price_reaction: Good pricing. Free to start, referral to taste Pro, annual to commit. Multiple entry points.

name: Soren Lam
clarity_response: A taste profile app that helps you discover better plans through friends. Rate past experiences, find future ones. One tap, network-powered.
strongest_line: Their discoveries become yours.
what_feels_off: The free tier could be more explicit about what discovery looks like without Pro. 'Basic friend activity' is vague.
objections: How does an empty profile feel? Is the first experience motivating or empty?
gut_reaction: The friend discovery section is the hook. 'Their discoveries become yours.' That's what I want — effortless discovery through people I trust.
unanswered_questions: How does an empty profile feel? Is the first experience motivating or empty?
price_reaction: $99/year IF the discovery features genuinely improve my weekends. That's the test.

name: Hana Reyes
clarity_response: Rate experiences, build your taste profile, discover what to do through friends' signal. Forward-looking discovery, not just backward-looking tracking.
strongest_line: Your friend who always finds the best dive bars? You'll see their top-rated spots.
what_feels_off: Very minor: no mention of a content or inspiration layer within the app. Pure friend-powered or is there editorial?
objections: Can I save plans for the future, not just rate past experiences?
gut_reaction: Annual pricing makes me consider Pro more seriously. $99/year feels more intentional than $12/month.
unanswered_questions: Can I save plans for the future, not just rate past experiences?
price_reaction: I'd impulse-subscribe to annual if the free month convinced me. The pricing funnel is smart.

name: Joaquin Jensen
clarity_response: A social discovery app — personal taste profiles from ratings, friend networks surface better plans. Designed to upgrade your weekends.
strongest_line: Choosing feels like work when you don't have a system.
what_feels_off: Nothing. Best version for mobile. I'd actually finish reading this on my phone.
objections: Does the app have any editorial or curated content, or purely friend-powered?
gut_reaction: This is the version where I go from 'cool concept' to 'downloading now.' The tighter page removes the friction between interest and action.
unanswered_questions: Does the app have any editorial or curated content, or purely friend-powered?
price_reaction: Fair price. Not cheap, not expensive. The free tier means I can verify value first.

name: Zoe Fernandez
clarity_response: Experience ranking meets friend-powered discovery. Rate things, build taste profile, find what's next through people you trust.
strongest_line: Network-powered discovery... Because it is one.
what_feels_off: The annual pricing is appealing but I'd want to try monthly first. Not a criticism — just how I buy things.
objections: What if my friends rate things in different cities?
dealbreaker_reason: Free version discovery is too limited for my actual need.
gut_reaction: Every section earns its place. The retention section is brief but it addresses my worry about abandoning. The compound effect is motivating.
unanswered_questions: What if my friends rate things in different cities?
price_reaction: $99/year puts it in 'investment in my social life' territory. I'd consider that framing.

name: Priya Chang
clarity_response: An app that creates your taste profile and uses friends' ratings for discovery. Both remembering what you did and finding what to do next.
strongest_line: Discover what's next through the people you trust.
what_feels_off: Nothing feels off. The forward-looking frame is clean. The network section is compelling. The price is fair.
objections: I'd download free and see if it sticks for a month before considering Pro.
gut_reaction: I'd download from this page. Whether I'd pay for Pro depends on how many friends join, but the free tier is enough to start.
unanswered_questions: I'd download free and see if it sticks for a month before considering Pro.
price_reaction: The annual option shifts this from 'another subscription' to 'a commitment to doing more.' That's different.

name: Mateo Griffin
clarity_response: A living taste profile with friend-network discovery. Rate experiences, see what friends recommend, discover better things to do.
strongest_line: Your taste deserves better than this.
what_feels_off: The only gap is between 'I'd download this' and 'this would change my behavior.' The page can't bridge that — the product has to.
objections: The discovery promise needs to feel real from week one, not just after months of data.
gut_reaction: The forward-looking angle is even clearer now. This isn't just about recording — it's about choosing better. That's my need.
unanswered_questions: The discovery promise needs to feel real from week one, not just after months of data.
price_reaction: I'd start free, probably stay free for a month, then consider $99/year if the network delivers.

name: Ravi Okonkwo
clarity_response: An experience app that goes beyond tracking — taste profile plus friend-powered discovery to help you find and do better things.
strongest_line: See what's highly rated by the people you actually trust.
what_feels_off: Nothing. The page has reached its ceiling for someone like me. I'm convinced enough to try.
objections: How does the app handle a Saturday afternoon when I'm bored? Walk me through that moment.
dealbreaker_reason: Free version discovery is too limited for my actual need.
gut_reaction: Shorter and punchier. I didn't skim once. For someone who scrolls past everything, that's high praise.
unanswered_questions: How does the app handle a Saturday afternoon when I'm bored? Walk me through that moment.
price_reaction: Good pricing structure. Removes the 'too expensive' knee-jerk reaction with the annual anchor.

name: Jordan Nguyen
clarity_response: Rate and rank experiences, build your taste profile, discover through friends. Not just a record — a system for better plans.
strongest_line: Less mediocre. More you.
what_feels_off: Minor wish: a mention of what the empty-profile experience looks like. But probably better addressed in onboarding.
objections: Convinced enough to try. Whether I'll sustain is the real question.
gut_reaction: I'm ready to try this. The page convinced me. Now the product needs to deliver.
unanswered_questions: Convinced enough to try. Whether I'll sustain is the real question.
price_reaction: $99/year is the option I'd choose. Monthly feels like I'm not committed.

name: Samir Novak
clarity_response: An app that builds a personal taste map from your ratings and uses friends for discovery. Works solo from day one, network grows with you.
strongest_line: First it's your map. Then it's your map plus everyone you trust.
what_feels_off: Almost nothing. The page now hits my situation perfectly even without naming it specifically.
objections: How many active users in my specific city?
gut_reaction: 'First it's your map. Then it's your map plus everyone you trust.' Standing on its own like that is even more powerful. That's my journey in one line.
unanswered_questions: How many active users in my specific city?
price_reaction: $99/year makes sense for my situation. I'm committing to this city — investing in a tool to know it better is worth it.

name: Declan Watanabe
clarity_response: A taste profile app with friend-powered discovery. Start with your personal map, add friends' signal as your network grows. Beli for everything.
strongest_line: Their discoveries become yours.

objections: Community discovery beyond my friend network — any plans for that?
gut_reaction: The tighter page works perfectly. I'm action-oriented — I don't need to be convinced, I need to be pointed. This does that.
unanswered_questions: Community discovery beyond my friend network — any plans for that?
price_reaction: The referral incentive plus annual pricing means I'd be on Pro within my first month. Easy.

name: Iris Torres
clarity_response: An experience ranking app — build your taste map, discover through friends. Solo value from day one, network value scales.

what_feels_off: Nothing feels off. The tighter format is better. I want to act, not read.
objections: Can I follow local tastemakers or food bloggers on the platform?
gut_reaction: Stronger flow. The cold-start answer isn't buried in a paragraph anymore — it's the headline of the network section's close.
unanswered_questions: Can I follow local tastemakers or food bloggers on the platform?
price_reaction: Fair price. I spend more than $99 on mediocre restaurant experiences in a month. This saves money long-term.

name: Reese Mensah

gut_reaction: I'd download this the second I saw it in a TikTok ad. The page is the right length and the concept is perfect for my situation.
unanswered_questions: Is the app location-aware? Does it surface nearby-rated experiences?
price_reaction: $99/year is a no-brainer if the network is active in my city. The free month via referral lets me verify.

name: Leo Abadi

strongest_line: First it's your map. Then it's your map plus everyone you trust.

gut_reaction: The annual pricing is appealing. I'm committing to this city — committing to a tool that helps me map it makes sense.
unanswered_questions: Neighborhood-level browsing — can I filter by area?
price_reaction: Annual pricing feels right for someone building a life in a new city. It's a year-one investment.

price_reaction: Smart pricing. The free tier builds my taste map, the referral month shows me the network, annual Pro is the obvious next step.

unanswered_questions: Multi-city taste profiles for when I visit other places?

unanswered_questions: No copy objections. Product questions only.

name: Andre Morales
clarity_response: An experience ranking system — personal taste map plus friend-powered discovery. Start solo, grow social, discover through trust.

name: Olivia Dubois
clarity_response: Build a taste profile from experience ratings, discover through friends. Solo taste map from day one, network makes it better.
strongest_line: This isn't a trial. It's the real product.
what_feels_off: The cleanest version. No wasted words. Every section pulls its weight.
objections: Convinced. The page has done its job.
gut_reaction: Strongest version. Clean, fast, convincing. My only remaining question is how many users are in my city, which the page can't answer.
unanswered_questions: Convinced. The page has done its job.
price_reaction: $99/year is the price of 3 mediocre dinners. If this helps me avoid mediocre dinners, it's already paid for itself.
